fields.title: max-product on trees
fields.pointers:
* If we apply the BP update rules in a non-tree graph, it often still works; this is known as  [loopy BP](loopy_belief_propagation) .
* We can apply (exact) BP to any MRF using the  [junction tree representation](junction_trees) , although possibly with a large increase in complexity
* The  [special case](gaussian_bp_on_trees)  of Gaussian graphical models
* Some HMM inference algorithms  [can be interpreted as belief propagation](hmm_inference_as_bp)
* If we have a polytree or chordal MRF, we can convert it to a  [factor graph](factor_graphs)  and then  [run BP](factor_graph_bp) .
* BP  [can be interpreted](loopy_bp_as_variational)  as fixed point updates to an optimization problem involving Bethe free energy.
fields.summary: Max-product is an algorithm for MAP estimation in graphical models, based on dynamic programming. It is a generalization of the Viterbi algorithm for hidden Markov models.
